events.description: The release of the Purchasing Managers' Index for the French construction sector for January 2026.

facts.fact_text: The HCOB Construction PMI in France was 43.5 in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The HCOB Construction PMI in France came in at 43.5 in January 2026, broadly unchanged from December and November.

facts.fact_text: The downturn in the French construction sector began in June 2022.

evidences.evidence_text: extending the severe downturn that began in June 2022.

facts.fact_text: Employment levels in the construction sector continued to fall in January.

evidences.evidence_text: Employment levels continued to fall, but job losses eased for a second month and were only marginal overall.

facts.fact_text: Supplier delivery times lengthened for the eighth consecutive month.

evidences.evidence_text: Supplier delivery times lengthened for the eighth consecutive month, though delays were moderate and the weakest since July.

claims.claim_text: Firms forecast a further decline in construction activity over the next year.
claims.author: French construction firms

evidences.evidence_text: Looking ahead, expectations remained bleak, with firms forecasting a further decline in activity over the next 12 months.

claims.claim_text: The construction sector is experiencing a sharp contraction.
claims.author: HCOB

evidences.evidence_text: The data signaled another sharp contraction in construction sector activity

evidence.evidence_text: The data signaled another sharp contraction in construction sector activity
New orders fell significantly... amid ongoing subdued demand.
extending the severe downturn that began in June 2022.
